issue.title: [CF 525] r532 bug thread
issue.body:
Metaicons are still functional from what I can tell but they can't be edited (you just get a blank editor). This is the error that occured:

Date: 2012-08-12 15:29:24
ID: 2
Error occured in: Global
Count: 1
Message: ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua line 2037:
   CreateFrame(): Couldn't find inherited node "TellMeWhen_MetaIconOptions"
Debug:
   [C]: ?
   [C]: CreateFrame()
   ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2037: PositionPanels()
   ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2248: Load()
   ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:6568:
      ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:6565
   TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4701:
      TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4698
   [C]: ?


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #525 | Raw

comments.body:
Date: 2012-08-12 15:51:27
ID: 3
Error occured in: Global
Count: 1
Message: ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua line 2037:
CreateFrame(): Couldn't find inherited node "TellMeWhen_ConditionIconSettings"
Debug:
[C]: ?
[C]: CreateFrame()
...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2037: PositionPanels()
...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:2248: Load()
...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:6568:
...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:6565
TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4701:
TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4698
[C]: ?

Presumably the same error elsewhere.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I also noticed that a few event triggers are missing from metaicons. Namely "On Start", "On Finish", "On Duration Changed", "On Spell Changed". Not sure if this might be intended or not.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I had some kind of TellMeWhen crash where it completely disappeared and launched a box asking me to restart WoW. So I did. Metaicons now work again and the errors aren't reoccuring.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Interesting that it played out the way that it did for you, but all these errors (except the event handlers not being listed for meta icons) were the result of me renaming all of the folders that house icon type data from "IconView" to "IconType" (I swear, typos will be the death of me some day).


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Have I ever mentioned how much I absolutely hate meta icons? Because I do. There are just way too many special cases that apply to meta icons that don't apply to any other icon type.

For example, if I declare that meta icons use the duration attributes, then they will implement the four duration-related events, but they will also have to implement the duration min/max setting.

Now, if I expand that and say that I also want meta icons to be able to implement the On Spell Changed event, then they will also have to implement the configuration for power bar overlays, even though these overlays won't actually work because the inherited data from other icons will always override it.

Rant, rant, rant. Basically, the framework that I just spent the last 3 months designing and building doesn't work well at all with meta icons.

EDIT: nevermind. I managed to completely forget about the part that I made that allows for half-decent handling of situations like this.

Edited Aug 12, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I've built this condition icon:

^1^T^SType^Sconditionicon ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SBUFFDUR ^SChecked^B ^SUnit^Splayer;`party1-4 ^SName^SBlessing`of`Kings ^t^N2^T ^SType^SBUFFDUR ^SChecked^B ^SUnit^Splayer;`party1-4 ^SName^SBlessing`of`Might ^t^N3^T ^SType^SINSTANCE ^SOperator^S|= ^SLevel^N1 ^SPrtsBefore^N1 ^t^N4^T ^SType^SINSTANCE ^SPrtsAfter^N1 ^SOperator^S|= ^SLevel^N2 ^t^Sn^N4 ^t^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sbar^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sicon1 ^t^t^SCustomTex^SBlessing`of`Kings ^SEnabled^B ^t^N60015^S`| ^Sicon^^

It's basically supposed to tell me when I haven't buffed Kings or Might. And it's still very basic. I first set out to build an icon with the same functionality using a Buff/Debuff icon, but I ran into trouble. Not able to pinpoint the issue I created a condition icon instead and it's still not working. However it's beginning to dawn on me that the icon isn't updating properly on aura gains/fades. The icon assumes the correct state after opening and closing TMW, but remains unchanged after buffing or clicking off Kings.

Edited Aug 15, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

When copying the position/scale of another group TMW doesn't copy the relative point setting, leading to the copied group ending up somewhere else than the original group.

Edited Aug 15, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I think I have gotten workarounds implemented for most of the script ran too long errors.

The only caveat is that TMW is now forcibly locked while in combat now (since errors pop up if you try to lock it while in combat, TMW locks itself immediately before WoW goes into combat lockdown and the script run duration limit is enforced.)

All config frames (the icon editor and the main options frame from '/tmw options' and the LDB plugin) are also closed when entering combat and cannot be opened while in combat.

Now I wait for beta servers to come back up.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Tickets like this are hard to keep track of. Post new stuff in their own tickets.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
